channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: He built Michigan's Medicaid work requirement system. Now he's warning other states
item.description: Michigan's health director spent a year and $30 million building a work requirements system for Medicaid. The problems he encountered have him worried...

item.title: What was with all those teen heartthrob Bobbys in the '60s?
item.description: Bobbys were inescapable in music in the '50s and '60s: Bobby Sherman, Bobby Rydell, Bobby Darin and more. NPR critic Bob Mondello looks back to an era...

item.title: Over what does the Trump admin want to unleash 'dominance'? Find out in the quiz
item.description: Plus: physical fitness, Confederate statues, robot overlords and weird zoo requests.

item.title: California rushes to plan a still unscheduled election in US House seats standoff with Texas

item.description: The plan faces fierce opposition within Israel as well as international criticism.

item.title: Wildfires force Turkey to close key waterway

item.title: Eleven domestic workers arrested over illegal abortions in Hong Kong
item.description: Police stress they do not believe the women, in their 30s and 40s, are in a crime syndicate.

item.title: An EPA proposal could lead U.S. auto makers to shift their strategy on EVs
item.description: An EPA proposal seeks to revoke a key emissions finding which experts say would remove pressure on auto makers to produce EVs.

item.title: Crocs US sales tumble as shoppers choose trainers

item.title: Trump orders colleges to prove they don’t consider race in admissions
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday signed a memorandum requiring colleges to prove they do not consider race in admissions.
